humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report provides a gross description of the left breast lumpectomy specimen, which includes a poorly differentiated mass with a greatest dimension of 3.0 cm. Based on the rules provided, a T2 tumor is defined as being more than 2 cm but not more than 5 cm. Therefore, the pathologic T stage for this patient's cancer is T2.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report indicates that the tumor measures 3.0 cm in greatest dimension, which falls under T2 stage (T2: Tumor size > 2 cm and ≤ 5 cm) according to the American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC) staging system. The T stage is determined by the size of the tumor in the breast and does not include the information about lymph node involvement or metastasis. Therefore, the T stage from this report is T2.
